properties.areaDesc: Wyoming, WV; Raleigh, WV; Dickenson, VA; Mingo, WV; Buchanan, VA; McDowell, WV
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 6 at 5:59PM EST until February 7 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Charleston WV
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Charleston has extended the

* Flood Warning for Small Streams in...
Buchanan County in southwestern Virginia...
Dickenson County in southwestern Virginia...
Southeastern Raleigh County in southeastern West Virginia...
McDowell County in southern West Virginia...
Southeastern Mingo County in southern West Virginia...
Wyoming County in southern West Virginia...

* Until 100 AM EST Friday.

* At 559 PM EST, Emergency Management, Trained Spotters and
Observers have reported flooding of several roads along small
streams and creeks across the warned area.

At 2:30PM...The Stage reading near Bradshaw on the Dry Fork of the
Tug Fork River was 12.96 feet and rising.  The estimated flood stage
is 10 feet.  Stages between 10 and 15 feet, homes along the river
downstream of the gage are flooded.  Sections of Route 80 and 83
start to flood.

At 2:30PM, The stage on the Cranes Nest River near Clintwood was
14.73 feet and falling. The River crested at 14.81 feet at 1:45PM.
The estimated flood stage is 13 feet.  At stages near 13 feet, Route
649, upstream of gage 200 feet from railroad bridge, floods. Also,
several camps along river flood.

At 2:30PM...The Guyandotte River at Pineville was 11.22 feet and
rising.  The river is expected to crest just below the 13 foot flood
stage just after midnight tonight. At stages near 13 feet, Homes and
some businesses along Rockcastle Creek near Pine Aveneue and Main
Street start to flood due to backwater from the Guyandotte. Also,
some homes start to flood one quarter mile downstream from the river
gage near the confluence of the Williams Branch Creek and the
Guyandotte. River.



* At 5:20PM...The river stage reading near Bradshaw on the Dry Fork
of
the Tug Fork River was 13.35 feet and may be nearing the crest.  The
estimated flood stage is 10 feet.  Stages between 10 and 15 feet,
homes along the river downstream of the gage are flooded.  Sections
of Route 80 and 83 start to flood.

At 5:20PM, The stage on the Cranes Nest River near Clintwood was
13.70 feet and falling. The River crested at 14.81 feet at 1:45PM.
The estimated flood stage is 13 feet.  At stages near 13 feet, Route
649, upstream of the gage 200 feet from railroad bridge, floods.
Also, several camps along river flood.

At 5:20PM...The Guyandotte River at Pineville was 11.47 feet and may
be near its crest.  The river has a 13 foot flood stage. At stages
near 13 feet, Homes and some businesses along Rockcastle Creek near
Pine Avenue and Main Street start to flood due to backwater from the
Guyandotte. Also, some homes start to flood one quarter mile
downstream from the river gage near the confluence of the Williams
Branch Creek and the Guyandotte River.

Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Welch, Clintwood, Grundy, Pineville, Haysi, Davenport, Breaks
Interstate, John Flannagan Lake, Mullens, Sophia, Gary, War,
Northfork, Hanover, Gilbert Creek, Big Rock, Twin Falls State Park,
Trammel, Coal City, Bradshaw and Beaver.

Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.25 inches are possible
through the evening before turning to snow later tonight.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Please report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by
calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. You may
also report severe weather by posting your report to the Charleston
West Virginia National Weather Service Facebook Page, or by using
the Twitter Hashtag, NWSRLX.
